clinical_study.brief_title: Neural Changes Associated With a Mindfulness-based Intervention for Young Adults With Childhood Maltreatment
clinical_study.official_title: Neural Changes Associated With a Mindfulness-based Intervention for Young Adults With Childhood Maltreatment

brief_summary.textblock: Childhood maltreatment is remarkably prevalent, and it has been shown to be associated with a wide spectrum of mental health problems, and it also been shown to be associated with smaller hippocampal volumes. This trial aims to see whether the 8-week mindfulness based stress reduction intervention can reduce the symptoms of depression, anxiety and PTSD for young adults with childhood maltreatment, and whether it can increase the hippocampal volumes.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty subjects with early life adversity such as parental emotional neglect, verbal abuse, physical abuse, sexual abuse or peer bullying, will be recruited into the study, half of them will be allocated to the group to receive an 8-week mindfulness based stress reduction(MBSR) intervention, half of them will be allocated to the waitlist control group which will complete the same research procedures as the MBSR group at the same time and receive the MBSR intervention after the waiting period. MRI and a battery of self report questionnaires will be administered before and after the intervention for investigating changes in hippocampal volumes, perceived stress, depression and anxiety. Primary hypotheses include increased hippocampal volumes and reduced levels of perceived stress, depression and anxiety.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Hippocampal Volumes (High resolution MRI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After (within 3 weeks) the 8-week MBSR program compared to baseline measurement within 3 weeks before the intervention program starts.
primary_outcome.description: High resolution MRI will be acquired from all subjects before and after the intervention for analyzing changes in hippocampal volumes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Levels of Depression (Beck Depression Inventory)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After (within 3 weeks) the 8-week MBSR program compared to baseline measurement within 3 weeks before the intervention program starts.
secondary_outcome.description: Beck Depression Inventory will be administered to measure the amounts of depression symptoms before and after the intervention for changes in depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Levels of Anxiety (Anxiety Sensitivity Index and State-Trait Anxiety scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After (within 3 weeks) the 8-week MBSR program compared to baseline measurement within 3 weeks before the intervention program starts.
secondary_outcome.description: Anxiety Sensitivity Index and State-Trait Anxiety scale will be administered to measure the amounts of anxiety symptoms before and after the intervention for changes in anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Levels of Perceived Stress (measure levels of perceived stress)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After (within 3 weeks) the 8-week MBSR program compared to baseline measurement within 3 weeks before the intervention program starts.
secondary_outcome.description: The perceived stress scale will be administered to measure levels of perceived stress so as to investigate changes of perceived stress after the intervention.

arm_group.description: Mindfulness based stress reduction intervention will be provided to this group.
This arm waits while the MBSR group receives their intervention, and then gets the Mindfulness based stress reduction intervention after their waiting period.

intervention.description: The intervention will be an 8-week structured program about mindfulness based stress reduction that teaches skills of mindfulness meditation and mindful yoga.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Experience of childhood maltreatment
- With current age between 21 to 35 years old
- With current symptoms of depression or anxiety or PTSD or significant general stress.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of psychiatric disorders with psychotic features
- Suicidal attempts during the past six months
- Neurological disorders
- And common MRI exclusion criteria
- Prior history with MBSR or other systematic meditation programs.
